attributes.comment:
I am writing to express my dismay at the proposed increases to the USCIS
fees, particularly as they relate to international adoption. I recommend that the
fees remain at current rates, as many families must file 2x because the approval
to adopt is only valid for 18 months, and the USCIS does not permit renewal at a
reduced rate.
The proposed increase is almost $1,000-over 140%, with no increase in services
or expediency! This also does NOT take into consideration the increase in charge
for my child's IR4 visa-another 120% increase! Sometimes this certificate of
citizenship can take upwards of a year.
International adoption is a financially draining experience for the average American,
with current expenses reaching $40,000 and beyond, potentially. By increasing
the USCIS fees, you are further limiting the ability of many Americans to grow their
families by adoption.
Please reconsider this fee increase proposal as it relates to adoption fees, and
keep them at current rates.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Lisa Sargavakian
